threejs.title: Cosmos Tarot - Tarot Time with Your Cute Companion
threejs.metaDescription: A quiet time to find answers in your heart. Enjoy 24/7 tarot consultations with an adorable character friend. A special space to organize complex thoughts and listen to your inner voice.
threejs.keywords: cute character, 24-hour tarot, heart consultation, tarot friend, healing tarot, chat with character, mind organization
threejs.mainHeading: Tarot Time with Your Cute Friend

intro.paragraph1: Cosmos Tarot's special character friend is waiting for you. When your mind feels complex, when you need some alone time, come visit anytime for a comfortable conversation.
intro.paragraph2: On this page, you can experience a friendlier and warmer tarot reading with a lively character. We offer moments where you can focus entirely on yourself without rushing or worrying about others' eyes.

pageFeatures.title: What Makes This Character Page Special

characterCompanion.title: Warm Companion
characterCompanion.description: Tarot time with a cute friend instead of being alone. You can comfortably share your thoughts as if talking to an old friend.

visualComfort.title: Comfortable Visual Experience
visualComfort.description: The gentle and friendly character helps you naturally focus on tarot consultation without tension.

emotionalConnection.title: Emotional Bond
emotionalConnection.description: Experience warmer consultation through interaction with a character that has expressions and movements, not just text.

whenToVisit.title: Visit Your Character Friend in These Moments
whenToVisit.bedtime: When you want to organize your day and comfort your heart before sleep
whenToVisit.worry: When you have many concerns and need someone to talk to, but want a non-judgmental companion
whenToVisit.newStart: When you need courage before a new beginning
whenToVisit.dailyBreak: When you want to take a break from busy daily life and reflect on your heart

experience.title: What Kind of Experience Will You Have
experience.description: This space with your character friend offers the comfort of having tea and chatting with a close friend in a cozy cafe. Without complex functions or difficult explanations, the process of naturally selecting cards and receiving messages will feel warmer and more meaningful.

accessibility.title: Anytime, Anywhere
accessibility.description: You can meet your smoothly moving character friend from any smartphone, tablet, or computer. It's optimized to focus only on heart communication, leaving technical complexities behind.

philosophy.title: Our Philosophy
philosophy.description: Cosmos Tarot doesn't force answers, but serves as a warm companion helping you discover the answers already within your heart. Your character friend is the same - not judging or evaluating, but simply listening to your story and being there with you.

invitation.description: When you want to pause in your busy day to face yourself, or when you want to prepare your heart for a new day. Your cute character friend is always waiting quietly by your side.

noscript.title: Cosmos Tarot Character
noscript.message1: JavaScript is required for the tarot experience with your character friend.
noscript.message2: Please enable JavaScript in your browser and let's meet again.

mypage.title: My Page - My Tarot Journey
mypage.metaDescription: Manage personal tarot reading records and statistical analysis. Check your exclusive tarot consultation history and patterns stored for up to 3 months.
mypage.keywords: my page, tarot consultation records, tarot consultation statistics, personal tarot data, tarot pattern analysis

intro.paragraph1: Look back on your unique tarot journey in My Page. From past consultation records to personal card statistics, your entire tarot story is organized here.
intro.paragraph2: Through reading records stored for up to 3 months, you can revisit past advice and discover your personal tarot patterns to feel your steps of personal growth.

recordManagement.title: Record Management
recordManagement.description: View past tarot reading results organized by theme and question target, and delete any records you want at any time.

statisticalAnalysis.title: Statistical Analysis
statisticalAnalysis.description: Visualize the frequency of major and minor cards with graphs organized by theme and question target to understand your personal tarot patterns.

dataManagement.title: Data Storage and Management
dataManagement.description: All consultation records are securely stored for up to 3 months, and you can select and delete any records you want at any time.

personalGrowth.title: Personal Growth Tracking
personalGrowth.description: Track your inner changes and growth through your changing tarot patterns over time. Analyze which cards appear frequently and what themes you ask about most to use as a tool for self-reflection.

privacy.title: Privacy Protection
privacy.description: All information in My Page can only be accessed by you, and tarot reading contents and personal settings are managed completely privately. We guarantee your right to delete all data or withdraw from the account at any time.

etc.title: More - Everything About Tarot
etc.metaDescription: From learning tarot to terms of service and tarot history. Check all information and learning materials about Cosmos Tarot in one place.
etc.keywords: learn tarot, terms of service, tarot history, tarot learning, tarot knowledge, more

intro.paragraph1: Explore deep knowledge about tarot in Cosmos Tarot's More section. From learning materials for beginners to the long history of tarot, all information is systematically organized.
intro.paragraph2: Along with friendly guides for those new to tarot, we transparently provide terms information necessary for service use. Understand the mysterious world of tarot more deeply.

learnTarot.title: Learn Tarot
learnTarot.description: Learn step by step from basic tarot card concepts to the meaning of each card and spread methods. We provide friendly guides that even beginners can easily follow.

termsService.title: Terms of Service
termsService.description: We transparently disclose all terms and policies you need to know when using Cosmos Tarot service. You can clearly check privacy policies, service usage rules, and more.

tarotHistory.title: Tarot History
tarotHistory.description: Introducing hundreds of years of tarot history and tradition. From the origins of tarot cards to modern interpretations, you can understand the deep roots of tarot.

educational.title: Features of Learning Materials
educational.description: Complex and difficult tarot knowledge is structured step by step so anyone can easily understand. We provide a balanced mix of theoretical explanations and practical tips, so even those new to tarot can learn without burden.

transparency.title: Transparent Information Provision
transparency.description: All service-related information is organized so users can easily find and understand. From terms content to the historical background of tarot, we clearly provide everything you're curious about.

meta.title: Principles of Tarot Cards: Carl Jung's Collective Unconscious Theory
meta.description: Scientific interpretation of tarot cards based on Carl Gustav Jung's collective unconscious and synchronicity principles. Learn the principles of AI tarot and proper usage methods.
meta.keywords: Jung psychology, collective unconscious, synchronicity principle, tarot card principles, AI tarot, Carl Gustav Jung, tarot theory, unconscious connection, tarot interpretation, psychological tarot, free tarot, tarot cards, love tarot, daily fortune, tarot app

header.subtitle: Understanding the scientific principles of tarot cards through Carl Gustav Jung's psychological approach

theory.title: Collective Unconscious Theory
theory.content: Psychiatrist and psychologist Carl Gustav Jung believed that the realm of collective unconscious shared by humanity could be understood through tarot cards. According to his theory, the collective unconscious is a characteristic common to all humanity, and we are connected to each other in the deep realm of the unconscious.

synchronicity.title: The Principle of Synchronicity
synchronicity.content: Based on this perspective, Jung developed the 'principle of synchronicity'. This means that events that occur simultaneously by chance are actually deeply related through unconscious connections.

application.title: Application of Synchronicity
application.content: He applied this principle to tarot cards, explaining that a special connection is made between the questioner's unconscious and the cards at the moment of card selection.

methods.title: Validity of Various Selection Methods
methods.intro: According to these principles, all of the following methods are valid:
methods.item2: Having someone else draw cards for you
methods.item3: Focusing and selecting while only thinking about the question without mentioning names

energy.title: Importance of Momentary Energy
energy.content: It's important to note that tarot cards show results based on the energy of the moment when the question is asked. Since human emotions and situations can constantly change, this should be kept in mind when interpreting.

additional.title: Using Additional Confirmations
additional.content: If the answer feels ambiguous, it may be helpful to check additional cards 2-3 times.

caution.title: Precautions for Healthy Usage
caution.content: However, excessive dependence can have negative effects on mental health, so please use it within appropriate limits.

conclusion.title: Psychological Approach
conclusion.content: Cosmos Tarot also provides meaningful insights by reflecting users' unconscious choices and momentary energy based on Jung's theory. Tarot cards based on scientific evidence and psychological understanding can be used as a tool for self-reflection beyond simple fortune-telling.

question.subject: Target(opt.):
question.theme-description: Sentiments, love, relation, job, decision, conscience, etc (factualX, intellectualX)
question.question: Question(mandatory):
question.six_principle_instruction:
Please briefly provide the content of the question within 600 characters. If possible, include details on who, what, when, where, why, and how in a clear and concise manner.

e.g.1) What's in his (or my) heart?
e.g.2) What are his feelings towards his girl friend?
question.six_principle_instruction_options:
Please briefly provide the content of the question within 1100 characters. If possible, include details on who, what, when, where, why, and how in a clear and concise manner.

e.g.1) What's in his (or my) heart?
e.g.2) What are his feelings towards his girl friend?
question.situation_instruction: Please provide concise details within 600 characters about the target(subject) of the question, the counterpart of the target (if applicable), any third parties (if applicable), and the circumstances.

description.single: A quick overview of the main influence.
description.two: Detailed analysis of two aspects or options.
description.two_choice: Binary choice with two options predetermined in the question.
description.three: Analysis of 3 key aspects or options. Clear results. Commonly utilized. Recommended.
description.three_time: Sequential card draws symbolize past, present, and future
description.three_solution: Advice on problem analysis and solution advice.
description.three_a_day: Fortune or state of mind for morning, daytime, and evening  for a day.
description.three_choice: Three-way choice with three options predetermined in the question.
description.four: Analysis of 4 key aspects, timeframes, or options. Recommended.
description.five_relationship: Two people's states, bond, issues, and prospects.
description.six-day: Daily fortune/heart forecast for next 6 days from today.
description.six-week: Weekly fortune/heart forecast for next 6 weeks from this week.
description.six-month: Monthly fortune/heart forecast for next 6 months from this month.
description.celtic_cross: The most in-depth reading of a subject's current state and future path. Recommended.
description.single_speed_mode: A general overview or quick check recommended for a clear understanding of the primary influence.
description.two_speed_mode: Detailed insights into two aspects with predetermined content, suitable for binary choice.
description.three_speed_mode: Analysis of 3 aspects, timeframes, or options. Clear results. Commonly utilized.
description.four_speed_mode: Analysis of 4 key aspects, timeframes, or options.
description.five_relationship_speed_mode: Analyzing two individuals' states, relationship, challenges, and future outlook.
description.six_speed_mode: Daily, Weekly, or Monthly fortune/heart forecast for 6 units.
description.celtic_cross_speed_mode: The most thorough insight into a subject's current state and future path ahead.

content.chart_content:
A. Major Cards

Meaning:
Major cards represent important themes in life and significant influences.
The total number of Major cards (22 cards) corresponds to approximately 39% of the total number of Minor cards (56 cards). Therefore, statistically, the probability of drawing Major cards is lower. Generally, they appear around 25-30%, but this can vary depending on the individual and situation. When Major cards appear more frequently than this ratio, it carries the following meanings:
1. Important situations or emotions are at play in the relevant category (question subject, question entity, etc.).
2. The current situation indicates an 'influential' important period.
3. They may contain more powerful energy or messages than Minor cards.
For example, if many Major cards appear in a specific category like love, it could mean that the current relationship is at an important turning point in life or experiencing deep emotional experiences. It could also indicate that your current life is at a major turning point or that important opportunities for personal growth are approaching.

~

B. Minor Cards
Meaning:
Minor cards represent everyday aspects and specific events. Each card expresses daily situations, emotions, and states in more detail.
When many Minor cards appear in a tarot reading, it may have the following meanings:
1. The current situation is progressing routinely without dramatic changes.
2. It focuses mainly on daily problems and decisions by category.
3. Generally tends to indicate everyday situations or gradual changes rather than major changes.
This can also suggest that small daily choices can accumulate to create big changes over time.

~

C. Meanings by Element:
1. Fire (Wands Suit):
   - Symbol: Torch, Beacon, Flame
   - Color: Red, Orange
   - Season: Summer
   - Direction: South
   - Time: Noon
   - Meaning:
     * Energy: Vitality, Passion, Drive, Life Force
     * Creativity: Inspiration, Spark of Ideas, Artistic Impulse
     * Change: Rapid Transformation, Purification, Regeneration
     * Will: Determination, Courage, Self-assertion
     * Growth: Expansion, Development, Ambition
     * Action: Immediate Response, Impulse, Adventure, Active Progress, Passionate Drive
   - Positive Traits: Passion, Confidence, Leadership, Creativity, New Opportunities
   - Negative Traits: Aggressiveness, Impulsiveness, Overconfidence
   - Related Professions: Entrepreneur, Artist, Athlete, Leader
   - Body Parts: Head, Eyes, Nervous System
2. Water (Cups Suit):
   - Symbol: Cup, Chalice, Holy Grail
   - Color: Blue, Turquoise
   - Season: Autumn
   - Direction: West
   - Time: Twilight
   - Meaning:
     * Emotion: Feeling, Sentiment, Mood, Intuition
     * Relationships: Love, Friendship, Family Bonds
     * Imagination: Dreams, Fantasy, Creative Inspiration
     * Healing: Emotional Recovery, Forgiveness, Reconciliation
     * Flow: Adaptability, Flexibility, Acceptance of Change, Natural Flow
     * Unconscious: Deep Inner Self, Subconscious, Hidden Desires
   - Positive Traits: Empathy, Intuition, Creativity, Sensitivity
   - Negative Traits: Emotional Instability, Excessive Fantasy, Escapism
   - Related Professions: Counselor, Artist, Nurse, Chef
   - Body Parts: Chest, Heart, Lymphatic System
3. Air (Swords Suit):
   - Symbol: Sword, Blade, Dagger
   - Color: Yellow, Sky Blue
   - Season: Spring
   - Direction: East
   - Time: Dawn
   - Meaning:
     * Intellect: Logic, Analysis, Objectivity, Clarity
     * Communication: Language, Writing, Education, Information Exchange
     * Thought: Ideas, Concepts, Philosophy, Knowledge
     * Truth: Honesty, Transparency, Ethics, Justice
     * Conflict: Debate, Challenge, Opposition, Overcome
     * Decision: Choice, Judgment, Discernment
     * Speed: Quickness
   - Positive Traits: Intellectual Clarity, Analytical Ability, Fairness, Insight
   - Negative Traits: Coldness, Critical Nature, Over-analysis, Indecision
   - Related Professions: Writer, Lawyer, Scientist, Teacher
   - Body Parts: Lungs, Respiratory System, Nervous System
4. Earth (Pentacles Suit):
   - Symbol: Coin, Pentagon, Star
   - Color: Green, Brown
   - Season: Winter
   - Direction: North
   - Time: Midnight
   - Meaning:
     * Material World: Wealth, Possessions, Resources, Abundance
     * Practicality: Reality, Practical Skills, Efficiency
     * Stability: Security, Reliability, Caution, Durability
     * Health: Physical Well-being, Nutrition, Vitality
     * Work: Occupation, Career, Productivity, Achievement
     * Nature: Environment, Ecosystem, Plants, Animals
     * Fruition: Certain and Concrete Results
   - Positive Traits: Reliability, Patience, Practicality, Diligence
   - Negative Traits: Materialism, Stubbornness, Resistance to Change
   - Related Professions: Banker, Farmer, Architect, Environmental Expert
   - Body Parts: Hands, Feet, Muscles, Bones

~

D. When Specific Elements Appear Frequently:
Attention should be paid to the characteristics and domains of the corresponding element. For example, when many Wands (Fire) cards appear, it means that the energy of passion, creativity, and action is strongly at work. This might be a suitable time for new beginnings or projects, and it's important to utilize this energy constructively.

~

E. When Multiple Elements Appear in Balance:
This indicates that the current situation is receiving balanced influences from various aspects. There is a high possibility that different areas of life are working harmoniously.

~

F. When Specific Elements are Lacking:
There may be a need to consciously complement or develop the characteristics of the lacking element. For example, if few Water (Cups) cards appear, there might be a need to pay more attention to emotional aspects or relationships.
content.principle_content: Psychiatrist and psychologist Carl Gustav Jung believed that the realm of collective unconscious shared by humanity could be understood through Tarot cards. According to his theory, the collective unconscious is a characteristic common to all humanity, and we are connected to each other in the deep realm of the unconscious. Based on this perspective, Jung developed the 'principle of synchronicity.' This means that events that occur simultaneously by chance are actually deeply related through unconscious connections. He applied this principle to Tarot cards, explaining that at the moment of choosing a card, a special connection is formed between the questioner's unconscious and the card. Following this principle, meaningful results can be obtained whether you draw the cards directly, have someone else draw them for you, or even concentrate and choose while only thinking about the question without mentioning your name. It's important to note that Tarot cards show results based on the energy at the moment of questioning. Since human emotions and situations can continuously change, this should be kept in mind during interpretation. If the answer seems ambiguous, it may be helpful to check additional cards 2-3 times. However, excessive dependence can have a negative impact on mental health, so it should be used within appropriate limits.
content.explanation_content: The World of Tarot: A Guide to History, Meaning, and Interpretation
